div.l: For in oure will ther styketh euer a nayle
To haue an hore hed ⁊and a grene tayle
As hath a lek for thaugh oure might be gon
Oure will desyreth foly euer in on
For when we may not don̄ then wol we speke
Yit in oure asken olde ther͗e is fuyr y reke
Foure gledes haue we the whiche I shall deuyse
Auawntyng lying angur ⁊and couetyse
These foure sparkeles longeth vn to elde
Our olde lymes may wel ben vnwelde
But will shal not fayle that hit is soth
And yit I haue alwey a coltes toth
As mony yere as hit passed henne
Seth my tape of lyf bi gan to renne
Ful sicurly when I was born̄ a non
Deth drough the tap of lyf ⁊and let hit gon
And euer seth the tap hath ronne
Till that almost empty is the tonne
The strem of lyf now droppeth vpon the chymbe
The sely tonge may wel clappe ⁊and rynge
Of wrecchednesse that passed is ful yore
Wᵗith olde folk saue dotage is neuer more
¶ When oure ost herde this sermonyng
He bi gan to speke as lordly as a kyng
And seyde what a mownteth al this wyt
What shall we speke al day of holy wryt
The deuel made a reue for to preche
Or a souter a shipman or a leche
Say forth thi tale ⁊and tary not thi tyme
Lo depford ⁊and hit is almost pryme
Lo grenewych that mony a shrewe is Inne
Hit were al tyme thi tale to bi gynne
